There is insufficient evidence to support the use of ERCP in the treatment of acute gallstone pancreatitis.
Teriflunomide is effective in reducing relapse rates and disability progression in patients with relapsing MS.

Family planning can be an effective means of reducing the risk of mother-to-child transmission of HIV. However, the evidence is limited by the lack of data on the impact of integration of family planning into HIV testing and treatment.
There is insufficient evidence to support or refute the use of tinzaparin for the management of acute painful vasoocclusive crisis of sickle cell anaemia.
There is insufficient evidence to support or refute the use of tranexamic acid in hip fracture surgery.
There is no evidence to support or refute the use of a suture to close the peritoneum at abdominal surgery.
There is insufficient evidence to support or refute the use of gabapentin for the prophylaxis of migraine.
